thread.title: Black Horses remain unbeaten
thread.title_full: Black Horses remain unbeaten - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Black Horses remain unbeaten
text:
Ali Burnham scored twice and Hunter Can Arnum turned back five shots as unbeaten Schuylerville got past Queensbury 4-2 in a Foothills Council field hockey encounter on Tuesday afternoon.
The win improved the Black Horses' record to 13-0 overall and 12-0 in the league. The Spartans dropped to 11-3 and 9-3.
Queensbury goalkeeper Lauren DeLor had 21 saves.
More field hockey: Visiting Taconic Hills scored three goals in a little over 18 minutes of play in the first half and went on to blank Ichabod Crane 4-0 in a Patroon Conference encounter. After Morgan Hoose gave the Titans a 1-0 lead, Krysta Skabowski scored the next two goals for the visiting team. Lizzie Beck added a second-half tally for Taconic Hills. The Titans improved to 10-4 overall and 5-2 in the league. ... Freshman Sage Plemenik had a hat trick and goalkeeper Saudia Smith notched her sixth shutout of the season as host Scotia got past South Glens Falls 3-0 in a Foothills Council match. Smith finished with 16 saves.
Girls' soccer: Sophomore Rebecca Clair scored four times as Voorheesville drubbed Ravena 7-0 in a Colonial Council contest. Veda Hensel added two goals and three assists for the Blackbirds, now 13-1 in both overall and league play. Netminders Jordan Pettograsso and Emily Adams combined for seven saves and the shutout. ... Hannah Almy scored four times as Cobleskill-Richmondville defeated Fonda-Fultonville 5-1 in a Colonial Council affair. Alyssa Duval scored the Fonda goal. ... Senior Alexis Riffelbach scored a hat trick, including her 100th career goal, and teammate Lauren Drake also scored three goals as Catholic Central improved to 11-2 with a 9-1 Colonial Council win over Watervliet.
